availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Gabriel Caldwell Wharton (lawyer, CSA Lt. Co. 10th K Inf.)

body.p: Born in Springfield, Kentucky on June 13, 1839. Attended the University of Louisville in 1856 to study law. Began his law practice in Springfield in 1860. Enlisted in the 10th Kentucky infantry (CSA), and was commissioned as a major. Promoted to lieutenant colonel, 10th Kentucky Infantry in the spring of 1863. Died on February 21 1887 in Louisville, Kentucky.

bibl.p: Find A Grave, "Col Gabriel Caldwell Wharton ( June 13, 1838 - February 21, 1887)," Memorial #110430347, https://www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GRid=110430347&ref=acom (accessed June 26, 2017).; Dennis W. Belcher, The 10th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry in the Civil War: A History and Roster (Jefferson, North Carolina: McFarland & Company, Inc., 2009), 7; Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Washington County, District 1, p. 101.
